intro: Castilleja quibellii, commonly known as Quibell’s milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its reddish to orange flowers and yellow-green stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It forms symbiotic relationships with certain root systems, drawing nutrients from host plants. Its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements make it a notable species in its native range.
